name: Holiday Inn Express San Luis Obispo

reviews.text: This is not a new property, nor was it originally built as a Holiday Inn Express. Newly renovated with clean rooms and common areas. Average quality, but very clean and nothing to be upset about.
reviews.title: Average / not bad
Not too bad
reviews.text: For the price I paid, I expected a little more..... However, the room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Bedding and linens were newer, and in good condition, as was the furniture. It did have some nice amenities such as bathrobes, a small fridge, coffee maker, etc.... There was always plenty of parking available, and the entrance to our room was very easily accessible. If you're looking to spend a lot of time in downtown SLO, or if you're visiting other areas throughout the day - this is a clean and comfortable hotel to stay in. However, if you're looking for a romantic getaway this might not be the place to stay, and don't expect a nice view from your window. Please note: I would not recommend trying to get a room before check-in time (3 p.m.) -I tried to do this and wasted quite a bit of time coming back and being told to try back at another time.

We stayed here overnight, and were not expecting too much from the place. Our room was not ready when we arrived mid-afternoon, so we were directed to the 'Quarterdeck' diner next door. Very nice meal, and has a micro-brewery too, so you can get a real pint! We asked for a high floor, but accepted a mid-floor with king bed, which was clean and very well appointed, with a washing/dressing area separate from the bathroom, and a comfortable settee with table and desk. No problems with noisy aircon - in fact the only noise came from kids playing football in the corridor, and you have to blame the idiot parents for that, not the hotel staff! Internet access was free, as was a very good breakfast the next morning. This hotel isn't the Ritz, but excellent value for what we paid.
reviews.title: What a pleasent surprise!

reviews.text: This hotel does not live up to Holiday Inn Express standards. The building looks very nice from the exterior and is centrally located in a good area of town. I also found the lobby area to be nice. However, upon entering my room I found it to be outdated and not very clean. The blankets and bed spread appeared to be very old. There were large stains on the carpet and the furniture showed lots of wear. The A/C unit was 20+ years old and was noisy. This led me to believe that this has not always been a Holiday Inn Express. The hotel is in bad need of a renovation. I stayed on busisness and did not pay for my room so I blew it off. As I checked in at the front desk, a clerk quoted a man $140 for a room. If I had paid $140 out of my pocket I would have been irate! If you can book it for less than $70 or so...I would CONSIDER. Otherwise don't waste your time.
reviews.title: Needs Renovation!!!
Fantastic!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in San Luis Obispo during our vacation in October. The hotel's location was convenient and close to downtown. There was even a trolley stop in front of the hotel that whisked us to the Farmer's Market. We loved the bathrobes that were provided in the rooms and the wonderful breakfast each morning. The staff could not have been more helpful and made us feel like they appreciated our business. We have stayed at many newer Holiday Inn Express hotels, but this one was one of our favorites. My only complaint was some parking lot noise our first night.

reviews.title: Wonderful one-night stay
reviews.text: My husband and I recently did the drive up 1/101 and chose SLO as a stopping point. We found this hotel to be perfect for our needs. Friendly and efficient staff, sparkling clean room with a couple of bonuses (extra sink outside the main bath, light terry robes) that we didn't expect. The hot tub and pool were great after a long day in the car and also very clean. A good selection for our continental breakfast. We were quite pleased and would definitely recommend this hotel!

Stayed here on 17th August 2004. I have to pretty much concur with the previous review. There was definately a smell in the guest rooms, I thought it was the airconditioning. We changed our first room because of the smell and ants in the bathroom, but the second room still had the smell, although slightly better and no ants! It was an old hotel that had been partially renovated. The room itself had new carpet, curtains, bedcovers and the furniture was in good order. We were comfortabe enough and the linens on the beds were good quality as were the towels in the bathroom. The pool area was fine and the free breakfast was good also. All in all, we had a reasonable stay, but I would probably choose a newer hotel next time we're in the area (if there is one). Loved San Luis Obispo and can recommend eating at Hudson's Bar and Grill on Monterey Street, Downtown SLO.
reviews.title: O.K. for a 1 night stay.
Disappointing
reviews.text: I'm sorry, and I hate to be mean, but we did not have a good stay here at all. I looked up this hotel on tripadvisor before reserving it and the reviewer gave it a good review so we booked it. The room was renovated and it was decent looking, but there was this stench that kept us from sleeping. It was on our clothes and skin in the morning. I don't know what it was as I've never smelled anything like it before.

aka: Holiday Inn Express San Luis Obispo Hotel San Luis Obispo
description: Please Be Advised: Hotel Under Renovation. The Holiday Inn Express Hotel at San Luis Obispo is the area's closest hotel to California Polytechnic State University (Cal Poly). Enjoy the best of small town charm surrounded by the unrivaled natural beauty of the Central Coast - from the historic Mission in downtown San Luis Obispo, to the colorful shops, restaurants, wineries, hiking, and beaches. The rustic neighboring communities of Cambria, Hearst Castle, Pismo Beach and Paso Robles are just a short drive away. Our hotel offers a relaxing getaway with newly renovated, spacious rooms and suites featuring refrigerators, bath robes, and amenities to make you feel at home! Enjoy our complimentary deluxe full American breakfast. AAA approved, 3-Diamond rating. Come hop the trolley this Thursday to our weekly, regionally-famed, Farmer's Market. You will find an extensive selection of fresh produce, BBQ & live music!
